title: ASTYOKHE
content:
ASTYOKHE (Astyoche) was the Naiad-nymph of a fresh-water spring or fountain of the town of Troy in the Troad
        (Anatolia). Her son Tros was the eponymous founding-king of the city.

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 3. 140 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd
          A.D.) :
        "Erikhthonios (Erichthonius) inherited the rule [of the kingdom of the Troad], after marrying [the river]
        Simoeis' daughter Astyokhe (Astyoche) and fathering Tros."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
